text: [Music]
I I'm a
a pathetically
regular um and
moderate uh person so I know I don't get
up at 5: and work really really hard you
know I get up at at uh 6 or 7 and don't
really get started
on my work till 9:30 or 10 um I have a
couple kids and you know there's just
the kind of morning ritual of getting
them off to school and so my work day is
basically the school day that's when the
house is quiet um I think what I love
about really being engaged in the work
is um that it does tend to expand to
fill fill my time so I I might stop
working at you know 2: in the afternoon
and maybe I'll go for a run or for a
bike ride or something um but my mind
will be you know processing what what
I'm thinking and very often um you know
I'll wake up in the middle of the night
and I keep a pad by by the bed and and
um you know make these notes that either
make a lot of sense in the morning or
make no sense what whatsoever um but I
I'd love that feeling and I'm trying now
to get into something new and I'm not
quite there yet I haven't had like a
sort of critical mass of of you know I
haven't reached a point of critical mass
where I understand what I'm doing and
where it's filling my my my space and
I'm feeling a little bit um like
underemployed at the moment but when
things are really going it's just it
just really fills up um you know you
live with that novel for a long time and
and um I I I do uh I'm hoping I'll be
back into that place soon because it it
really does make your life feel feel
kind of full and it's it's a very
interesting um I think when you're
pretty far along in a novel there are
these two competing feelings there's
this sense of like you know
being really uh feel a real feeling of
urgency I want to be done you know this
is hard work I've been doing it I'm
tired um and also a kind of you know
feeling of sadness because um when it's
done it's done um at least for me it it
just gets put away I mean I I will will
read from my book and talk about my book
afterwards it's an entirely different
process I'm sort of analyzing it then or
or experiencing it from outside but when
it's of happening um it's engrossing in
a way that um you know not too many
other things are over a long period of
time
too I think I think whatever dramatic um
inclinations I might have screenplay um
definitely you know fills those uh
impulses I I write stories and and um in
fact this past year I've written a
couple stories and and I really love the
form it it I struggle with it though I
feel like uh
you know it it's just a different thing
for
me um the great thing about novel you
live with it and your characters can
deepen I think with story you know you
really need to see it whole um in a
short time and I just have a hard time
doing that um so the novel is a much
more um congenial form for me um never
wrote any poetry I do write some
non-fiction I like uh writing uh about
film and music if I can and occasionally
about politics um and I would like to
do more reporting I think it's really
good for for a novelist to do that but
it's um doesn't come naturally to me um
of trouble talking to
